ing: 3 pounds raw shrimp - peeled, deveined, and cut into small pieces
1/2 cup tomato and clam juice cocktail (such as ClamatoÂ®)
salt and ground black pepper to taste
des: "I tried many types of ceviche, none to my liking, so I made my own. I hope you enjoy it. It looks appetizing and it's really good, especially for hangovers. It's Sinaloa-style because of the slices of jalapenos and red onions. It's a delicate, classy dish. Serve on tostadas with TapatioÂ® hot sauce, sliced avocados, and Mexican beer."
ins:
Combine shrimp, white onion, and juice of 7 limes in a large bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until shrimp is opaque, about 12 hours. Drain, discarding accumulated juices.
Blend juice of remaining 7 limes with serrano chile pepper. Pour into a large bowl.
Combine shrimp and onion mixture, crabmeat, tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, jalapeno peppers, and cilantro in the bowl. Stir in tomato and clam juice cocktail. Season with salt and black pepper.
